title: Wetzel: Lane Kiffin left an actual playoff team for a theoretical one. He should be honest about why
content: Lane Kiffin might be a great coach, but he isn't being treated unfairly by Ole Miss or "the calendar" or anything else.

title: QB Rodgers calls out WRs after 'boo-worthy' loss
content: After an injured Aaron Rodgers finished one of the worst passing games of his career, the Steelers QB said he hopes his wide receivers show up during the next film sessions and run the right routes.

title: Bonitto seals win after Broncos switch up call on D
content: After the Broncos tweaked their defensive call during a timeout, linebacker Nick Bonitto swatted away Marcus Mariota's pass on a 2-point conversion attempt to preserve Denver's 27-26 overtime win against Washington on Sunday night.

title: WNBA, union agree to 40-day extension on CBA
content: The WNBA and WNBA Players Association agreed to a 40-day extension on the current CBA that includes the option for either party to terminate the extension with 48 hours' notice.

title: Kiffin takes LSU job, won't finish year with Rebels
content: Lane Kiffin is the new coach at LSU, and he will not continue with Ole Miss on its College Football Playoff run as the Rebels promoted Pete Golding to head coach.

title: Sources: Spartans target Fitzgerald as new coach
content: Pat Fitzgerald, 50, has emerged as the target of Michigan State's coaching search, sources told ESPN's Pete Thamel on Sunday night, confirming a report, and the sides are working toward a deal, which is expected to be finalized in the near future.

title: Stoops fired after 13 years at UK, owed $37.7M
content: Kentucky has fired football coach Mark Stoops, who had just completed his 13th season with a 5-7 record.

title: Titans' Chestnut says Jags punter threatened him
content: Titans running back Julius Chestnut alleged that Jaguars punter Logan Cooke threatened to kill him during Sunday's game. "I was just trying to play hard, and he came up to me and said he was going to kill me," Chestnut said.

title: 76ers' Embiid returns in chaotic 2OT loss to Hawks
content: Joel Embiid, Paul George and Tyrese Maxey shared the court for the first time this season Sunday night, but that became a footnote in a chaotic double-overtime loss to the Hawks.

title: Four intriguing divisions, 10 teams and playoffs on the line: Barnwell makes sense of close races
content: It feels like every division is still up for grabs this season. Let's take a closer look at particularly tight races in the NFC West, NFC South, AFC South and AFC North.

title: How Mike Vrabel galvanized Patriots to top of AFC in a year
content: Vrabel had a clear vision of the Patriots' future when hired in January. Now, they are competing again.

title: Giants see success for Jaxson Dart if he can avoid injury
content: The competitive fire that defined Dart's college career is now a liability. After his latest concussion, teammates and coaches are urging the prized rookie to protect himself.

title: Can Ohio State be beaten? Can Texas make the playoff? Can any team win the ACC?
content: Why the Buckeyes are so dominant, the ACC is so confusing and the playoff picture still isn't settled.

title: 'When do we get our Siakam?': What to make of the Bulls' uneven early season
content: From a 6-1 start to a 9-10 record to begin December, which Chicago Bulls team is the real version and what could be next?

title: Welcome to NFL draft season: 30 questions on the QBs, standout prospects and risers to watch
content: Who's in the hunt to go No. 1? How does the QB class look? Which teams need defense? And who could rise at the combine? Let's answer big questions on this class.

title: NFL draft risers, questions and notes: Can T.J. Parker climb back up the board?
content: We have draft notes, including what to make of T.J. Parker's three-sack game and Trevor Goosby's rise.

title: Fantasy Football Buzz: Justin Herbert set for surgery, but aims to play in Week 14
content: Herbert set for surgery, Meyers keeps producing for the Jaguars and Irving looked good in his return in Week 14

title: Winners and losers: Robinson runs wild, Adams makes history
content: Bijan Robinson, A.J. Brown and Patrick Mahomes led the way, but Lamar Jackson and Saquon Barkley disappointed.

title: How a bald coach solved volleyball's ponytail predicament
content: The NCAA volleyball tournament will feature dozens of stars wearing a hair-tie solution invented by none other than three-time champion Jerritt Elliott.

title: The NHL's best this week: Kyle Palmieri, 'hockey guy'
content: The Islanders forward tore his ACL -- then made a brilliant pass to set up a goal. Plus, what to watch this week.

title: Lane Kiffin, Thanksgiving and CFB conference champs: A busy weekend at the sportsbooks
content: How sportsbooks are evaluating Ole Miss and the College Football Playoff race, and more on NFL underdogs winning big on Thanksgiving.

title: NFL futures: Rams remain Super Bowl favorites despite loss
content: Updated win totals and odds for every team to make the playoffs, win their division, conference and Super Bowl.

title: Feast Week lessons: Michigan No. 1? St. John's, Florida in trouble?
content: From the Players Era in Las Vegas to a top-25 showdown in New York, here's what we learned last week.

title: 10 key games to watch in December
content: National champions facing off, the nastiest rivalry in college basketball and more are up this month.

title: Feast Week takeaways: Crooks' 47 points push Iowa State to 9-0
content: Big performances from Texas, LSU and Iowa State headline the most significant results from Feast Week.

title: Huskers earn top overall seed in NCAA tournament
content: Undefeated Nebraska earned the No. 1 overall seed in the NCAA women's volleyball tournament bracket released Sunday.

title: Chelsea, Arsenal put on a show of title hopefuls, Xabi Alonso's Madrid mess, more
content: Sunday's clash between Premier League title chasers lived up to expectations with drama, controversy and grit. PLUS: Xabi Alonso's tactics lead to Madrid losing more points, as Gab Marcotti recaps the weekend.

title: How do Barça contain Atlético's Jack Reacher-like striker?
content: Alexander Sørloth can haunt Barça again and send Atlético top of LaLiga when the sides meet on Tuesday.

title: Allende outshines Messi as Miami book spot vs. Vancouver
content: Tadeo Allende's performance of a lifetime, and the own goal that broke San Diego hearts. Cesar Hernandez and Joseph Lowery to sum up the best and worst of MLS' conference finals as Inter Miami book a date with Vancouver.

title: As Charlie Smyth shone in debut, Northern Ireland celebrated with free pints
content: The ex-Gaelic footballer-turned-New Orleans kicker had fans and family rooting for him from near and far.

title: McLaren's Qatar blunder has it on the brink of a 2007 rerun
content: In 2007, McLaren refused to favor either of its drivers, costing the team a title. After another botched call in Qatar, is history repeating itself?

title: AUSL Softball Expansion Draft 2025: How to watch on ESPN
content: The AUSL expands from four to six teams as Cascade and Oklahoma City Spark make their first picks in the 2025 expansion draft.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man City eye Semenyo move in January
content: Manchester City could move to sign AFC Bournemouth winger Antoine Semenyo in January. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Big faceoff brews in Pak: Unchecked power evades Munir; PM Sharif delays nod, flies to UK
content: Pakistan's Prime Minister is reportedly abroad to avoid issuing a notification for the appointment of the first Chief of Defence Forces, a role Field Marshal Asim Munir is set to assume. This move comes after the government missed a deadline to issue the notification, creating uncertainty about the army chief's position and the nuclear command authority.

title: All phones to have Sanchar Saathi: Govt issues orders; all about state-owned app
content: India's government is now requiring smartphone makers to pre-install the Sanchar Saathi cyber security app, which cannot be deleted. This move aims to combat cyber threats, track lost or stolen phones, and prevent counterfeit devices. The app, already available, has seen significant downloads and success in blocking and tracing devices since its January 2025 launch.

title: Bank scams: Mallya, Nirav, other fugitives owe over Rs 58K cr; only 33% recovered
content: Fugitive economic offenders owe Indian public sector banks over Rs 58,082 crore, including Rs 26,645 crore principal and Rs 31,437 crore interest as of October 2025. Fifteen individuals, including Vijay Mallya and Nirav Modi, have been declared Fugitive Economic Offenders, with nine linked to major bank frauds. Banks have recovered Rs 19,187 crore so far.

title: 'We are in deep trouble': How US is lagging behind China - Ford CEO explains
content: Ford CEO Jim Farley warns of a critical shortage of skilled tradespeople in the US, highlighting over a million unfilled jobs and a dangerous lag compared to China. He stresses the need for investment in trade education and rebuilding the blue-collar workforce, citing Ford's own efforts to eliminate tiered wages as a step towards career stability.

title: December OTT releases: 'Single Papa' to 'Mrs. Deshpande,' top series & movies that you can't miss
content: December 2025 brings exciting new Hindi series. Madhuri Dixit stars in the thriller 'Mrs. Deshpande'. 'Real Kashmir Football Club' explores sports drama with Manav Kaul. Kunal Kemmu features in the comedy-family drama 'Single Papa'. These releases promise diverse entertainment for viewers across platforms like JioHotstar, Sony Liv, and Netflix.

title: Kohli to reverse Test retirement? Ashwin says 'would not be right approach'
content: Ravichandran Ashwin backed Virat Kohli's deliberate Test retirement, urging respect for his decision despite fan hopes for a comeback after a stellar ODI century. Ashwin emphasized that such choices are well-considered and not impulsive. He advised accepting Kohli's stance, especially as the team navigates a transition, and cherishing the moments fans still get to witness him play.

title: After Faf, another ex-RCB and CSK star chooses to play in PSL over IPL
content: Former England all-rounder Moeen Ali has opted to play in the Pakistan Super League (PSL) 2026, foregoing the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2026. This decision follows a similar move by Faf du Plessis, who also withdrew from the IPL auction. Both players have expressed excitement for new challenges in the PSL.

title: 'Steve Jobs can't have that': What Bill Gates told Halo before buying it - co-creator reveals
content: Microsoft's 2000 acquisition of Bungie Studios, spurred by a 1999 Macworld demo of Halo with Steve Jobs, secured a flagship franchise for the then-upcoming Xbox.  Initially a Mac-exclusive concept, Microsoft's timely offer rescued a struggling Bungie and transformed Halo into a system-defining, billion-dollar success that reshaped console gaming.

title: 'Moment of pride': EC gets global recognition; comes amid oppn's SIR attack
content: India has been invited to chair the International Institute for Democracy and Electoral Assistance (International IDEA) for the first time, a recognition of its successful electoral process. Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar will assume the Chair on December 3, 2026, in Stockholm, Sweden. This appointment highlights India's significant experience in managing elections for its vast electorate.

title: Ashes: Usman Khawaja back in nets; Australia's opening question stays open
content: Usman Khawaja is progressing towards availability for the Gabba Ashes Test, though his back spasms are still being assessed for a full five-day match. He returned to nets for a cautious session, showing some discomfort but appearing more at ease. Meanwhile, Travis Head is open to batting anywhere, and Marnus Labuschagne backed Khawaja's importance to the team.

title: 'Gone back 8-9 years': Teammate recalls Virat Kohli moment after Ranchi heroics
content: Virat Kohli's magnificent 135 guided India to a 17-run victory over South Africa in the first ODI. Teammates lauded the former captain's stellar performance, with Kuldeep Yadav noting it evoked memories of his peak years. Assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate highlighted the importance of the strong first-innings total.

title: Thousands of Amazon employees send open letter to CEO; question layoffs
content: Over a thousand Amazon employees have penned an open letter, warning that the company's rapid AI development is jeopardizing its climate commitments and human workforce.  They argue the pursuit of AI dominance is leading to increased emissions, water scarcity, and job displacement, urging leadership to prioritize ethical AI and environmental responsibility.

title: Samantha Prabhu married: Where is Raj Nidimoru's name hidden in her mehendi design - exclusive
content: Actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu married Raj Nidimoru in an intimate Bhuta Shuddhi Vivaha ceremony at Isha Yoga Center. Her bridal mehendi, a minimalistic design by Arulmozhi Ilavarasu, featured the groom's name, Raj, subtly hidden on her right middle finger. Samantha was described as a happy, chirpy, and simple bride who desired a low-key wedding with loved ones.

title: Leon Draisaitl’s sharp message puts fresh spotlight on Connor McDavid’s leadership
content: Leon Draisaitl responded with 'Lol' to criticism about Edmonton Oilers' leadership.  The podcast suggested top players like Draisaitl and Connor McDavid should provide more direction.  Despite past Stanley Cup Final appearances, the Oilers face defensive struggles this season.  Their offense remains strong with McDavid and Draisaitl.  Fans are divided on the criticism.  The team's on-ice performance will ultimately show leadership.

title: Anamaria Goltes: All you need to know about Lakers star Luka Doncic’s fiancée
content: Luka Doncic's childhood sweetheart, Anamaria Goltes, a Slovenian model and entrepreneur, has been his unwavering support. The couple, who met as children, are building a life in Los Angeles with their daughter. Goltes skillfully balances her modeling career, influencer status, and life as a partner to a basketball superstar, adapting to his moves and embracing the spotlight.

title: 'Leave country now': Trump's blunt ultimatum to Maduro; US-Venezuela tensions flare
content: President Trump issued an ultimatum to Venezuela's Nicolás Maduro, offering safe passage in exchange for immediate departure. Maduro reportedly refused, demanding global amnesty and control of the armed forces, leading to collapsed talks. Trump acknowledged speaking with Maduro but offered no details, later warning of Venezuelan airspace closure amid escalating US military presence and accusations of fueling a drug crisis.

title: 'There is no senior pacer': Shami's exclusion sparks fresh debate
content: Former cricketer Mohammad Kaif expressed surprise at Mohammed Shami's exclusion from the South Africa ODI series. Despite strong domestic performances and being India's joint-highest wicket-taker in the last Champions Trophy, the veteran pacer was overlooked. Kaif highlighted Shami's wicket-taking ability and the valuable experience he could offer the young Indian pace attack, especially with Bumrah and Siraj rested.

title: Random Musing: Is 'AI teacher' Sophie a robot? Or are we?
content: A sceptical internet – quick to demonstrate the crab mentality evident among us – was quick to label the mannequin fitted with a speaker and an LLM as not a true robot. But the real question here is: what constitutes a true robot? Does it have to aid Luke Skywalker destroy the Death Star? Or search for its girlfriend while looking cute? Or be sent back in time to save or kill John Connor? Or cosplay as Shah Rukh Khan or Rajinikanth?

title: 'PM has hijacked Parliament': Gogoi on Day 1 of Winter Session; sets rider for cooperation
content: Gaurav Gogoi accused Prime Minister Modi of "hijacking Parliament" during the Winter Session, alleging the government refuses to discuss the Indian election system. Gogoi stated that while the opposition is willing to cooperate on government bills, the BJP is not accommodating opposition issues in the parliamentary agenda, undermining democratic functioning.

title: Govt to back air passengers in SC against Delhi, Mumbai airport operators in Rs 50,000 crore suit
content: The Indian government will back the Airports Economic Regulatory Authority of India (AERA) in a Supreme Court battle against Delhi and Mumbai airport operators. The case concerns a Rs 50,000-crore claim for hypothetical regulatory asset base, which could lead to significant hikes in passenger charges if awarded to the operators.

title: 'Use brains': 85-year-old ex-England cricketer warns Stokes's men ahead of 2nd Ashes Test
content: Legendary cricketer Geoffrey Boycott urges England to adopt a more strategic approach for the second Ashes Test at Brisbane. Following a crushing defeat in Perth, Boycott advises against reckless aggression, emphasising the need for batsmen to assess match situations. He also criticised captain Ben Stokes's 'has-beens' comment, highlighting the lack of Ashes success for the current squad in Australia.

title: 120/80 isn’t just a reading: What your blood pressure gap says about heart health
content: Understanding your blood pressure's two numbers, systolic and diastolic, is crucial for assessing heart and blood vessel health. Systolic measures the heart's pumping effort, while diastolic reflects pressure during relaxation, vital for heart muscle oxygenation. Age influences their significance, with diastolic being more predictive under 50 and systolic after 50 due to arterial stiffening.

title: Spying for Pak: BrahMos scientist gets clean chit; was accused of passing sensitive info
content: Nishant Agarwal, a scientist at BrahMos Aerospace Limited, has been cleared of major charges related to passing defense secrets. He was arrested in 2018. The higher judiciary has now absolved him of charges under the Information Technology Act and Official Secrets Act. Agarwal will be released soon, having served his sentence for possessing official documents on his personal device.

title: Shedeur Sanders’ mom stuns in proud mama style with glam game-day look
content: Shedeur Sanders made his professional home debut for the Cleveland Browns, showcasing his potential despite a loss to the 49ers. Supported by his stylish mother, Pilar, who also garnered attention, Shedeur aims to solidify his starting quarterback role. Coach Stefanski praised his commitment, highlighting his growth after his first start.

title: Murder selfie: How wife's intimate photo sent by lover enraged man; accused found sitting near body
content: A man murdered his estranged wife in a women's hostel after receiving an intimate photo of her with her lover. He then took a selfie with her body and posted it as his WhatsApp status. The accused was arrested at the scene and remanded to judicial custody.

title: Travis Kelce’s loud reaction sparks buzz after Pat McAfee’s emotional reveal
content: Kansas City Chiefs star Travis Kelce offered support to friend Pat McAfee. McAfee and his wife are expecting their second child in June 2026. This news comes after a difficult IVF journey. Kelce's message arrived during a tough period for the Chiefs. The team faces a crucial game to stay in playoff contention.

title: KIIT shock: BTech student found hanging; third death on Bhubaneswar campus this year
content: A first-year B Tech Computer Science student from Chhattisgarh, Rahul Yadav, was found hanging in his hostel room at KIIT. This marks the third student suicide on campus this year, prompting concern from local politicians and an ongoing police investigation with scientific teams collecting evidence.

title: 'As easy as making tea': Virender Sehwag hails Virat Kohli after Ranchi hundred
content: Virat Kohli's match-winning 135 against South Africa eased concerns about his form ahead of the 2027 World Cup. The 37-year-old's 52nd ODI century, his 83rd across formats, silenced discussions about his future. Kohli, batting with Rohit Sharma, steered India to a 17-run victory, showcasing his enduring hunger and passion for the game.

title: ‘Important to evaluate’: SC asks Centre to revisit Delhi air pollution action plan
content: The Supreme Court has urged the Centre and authorities to re-evaluate their Delhi NCR air pollution reduction strategies, questioning their effectiveness. The court emphasized examining all contributing factors beyond stubble-burning and noted the unfairness of solely blaming farmers. It highlighted the need to understand why clear skies were visible years ago but not now.

title: Cory Booker weds Alexis Lewis: Decoding the homosexuality rumours that have persisted for long
content: Senator Cory Booker's recent marriage to Alexis Lewis has reignited long-standing, baseless rumors about his sexuality. These whispers, circulating for over two decades, stemmed from his articulate nature and initial privacy regarding his orientation. Despite his marriage, the internet's tendency to cling to speculation highlights societal discomfort with complexity and stereotypes surrounding masculinity and public figures.

title: Samantha Ruth Prabhu flaunts giant wedding ring as she marries Raj Nidimoru
content: Actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu wed filmmaker Raj Nidimoru on Monday morning. The couple exchanged vows in a private ceremony attended by close family and friends. Samantha shared wedding photos on Instagram, showcasing her red bridal saree and the joyous occasion. The wedding took place at the Ling Bhairavi Temple within the Isha Yoga Centre.

title: Virat Kohli's siblings draw attention as Team India batter surpasses Sachin Tendulkar’s world record
content: Virat Kohli's 52nd ODI century, a remarkable 135 runs against South Africa, saw him surpass Sachin Tendulkar's record for most centuries in a single international format. His stellar performance, coupled with contributions from Rohit Sharma and KL Rahul, propelled India to a 349/8 total. India ultimately secured a 17-run victory in the first ODI.

title: ‘Stood up for women, paid with his life’: 20-man gang kills bodybuilder after tiff at wedding
content: A national-level bodybuilder and para-athlete from Rohtak, Rohit Dhankhar, died after being attacked for confronting men harassing women at a wedding. Dhankhar was severely beaten by a group of nearly 20 armed assailants after the wedding ceremony. His family alleges it was a planned murder for standing up for women's dignity.

title: Bomb threat mail spurs massive search at Kerala CM Vijayan’s house
content: Security was heightened at Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan's residence and a private bank following a bomb threat email. Bomb detection teams and sniffer dogs conducted thorough searches, ultimately confirming the threat as a hoax. This marks a recurring incident, with past emails referencing Tamil Nadu political developments.

title: Congress vs Tharoor: MP skips party’s key huddle; cites travel hurdle
content: Shashi Tharoor missed a key Congress strategy meeting ahead of Parliament's Winter Session, citing travel from Kerala with his elderly mother. This follows previous absences and public praise for Prime Minister Modi, intensifying friction within the party since his presidential election bid.

title: Drake Maye buzz: Wife Ann’s viral gym photo steals spotlight as Giants clash nears
content: New England Patriots quarterback Drake Maye is electrifying fans with his stellar performance, leading the team to a dominant 10-2 record. Off the field, his wife, Ann Michael Maye, is gaining a significant following on TikTok for her fitness and lifestyle content. Their combined popularity makes them a notable NFL power couple.

title: Final supermoon of the year to be visible December 4; know when, where and how to watch
content: The December 2025 Cold Moon, a supermoon, will be exceptionally large and bright, reaching a high point in the Northern Hemisphere sky. This celestial event, also known as the Long Nights Moon, occurs when the full moon coincides with perigee, its closest approach to Earth. Observers can best witness its impressive size and brightness at moonrise on December 5th.

title: Are you using right air purifier? Doctor sheds light on common mistakes people make when buying one
content: Your room size decides if the purifier will work, or not. Dr Kaushal explains - multiply room square footage by 2-4 for needed CADR. A 200 sq ft bedroom hence, needs 400-800 CADR. Check maker's room size chart-it is usually based on 8-foot ceilings. Open spaces or high ceilings need more power

title: Smriti Mandhana wedding postponed: Palash Muchhal seen in public for the first time - watch
content: Music composer Palash Muchhal was spotted at Mumbai airport with his family following the unexpected postponement of his wedding to cricketer Smriti Mandhana. Muchhal maintained a low profile, acknowledging photographers with a nod. The wedding was reportedly called off due to Smriti's father's health issues, with Muchhal also allegedly facing health complications.

title: 'Want to live, but what can I do?': UP BLO dies by suicide, another of heart attack amid ‘SIR stress’
content: Two Booth Level Officers (BLOs) in Uttar Pradesh have died while working on electoral roll revisions, one by suicide and another from a heart attack. These incidents bring the total BLO deaths during the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) exercise to at least seven, raising concerns about workload and pressure.

title: Steps to ensure pedestrian safety on zebra crossing
content: MVD officers have been instructed to cancel driving licences of drivers who violate pedestrian safety at zebra crossings

title: Centre defends exemptions for strategic, atomic mineral mining
content: “The exemption will not compromise environmental, social, health, and livelihood concerns.” says Union Minister of State for Environment, Kirti Vardhan Singh

title: A normal winter on the cards for Kerala in December
content: Minimum temperature has dropped below the 20° Celsius mark in many places in the State in the past few days, which is 3 to 4° C lower than the normal during the season

title: Number of village panchayats in the Nilgiris district increases from 35 to 88
content: The new village panchayats have been formed by splitting 27 existing village panchayats. The government has taken the decision, given the factors such as the hilly terrain, the lack of transport, and residents of the villages being unable to reach panchayat union offices

title: NTR Bharosa pensions extended to over 65 lakh beneficiaries, says Minister
content: Gottipati Ravi Kumar participates in the pension distribution drive at Yeleswarapalem in Bapatla district, and reviews the delivery of government services

title: Regional language education offered in 16% KVs, compulsory in Navodayas from Classes VI-IX: Centre
content: Across the country, 226 KVs offer regional language education in 10 languages; 665 of the sanctioned Navodaya Vidyalayas teach at least one of the 18 regional languages

title: Parts of India may get more cold wave days this year, says IMD
content: When the minimum temperature of a station is 10°C or less in the plains and 0°C or less in hilly regions, it is considered a ‘cold wave’ day

title: Andhra Pradesh to roll out film tourism policy; eyes world-class studios and 20% industry share
content: Minister Kandula Durgesh announces stamp duty reimbursement, SGST waivers for 15 years, and capital subsidies up to 25% to boost Telugu cinema and tourism infrastructure across seven anchor hubs

title: Diabetic women are more prone to having cardiovascular diseases compared to men: Expert
content: Women are probably at more risk of cardiovascular disease if they are getting treated for Type 2 diabetes, says Chitra Selvan, head of the Department of Endocrinology, Ramaiah Medical Centre

title: Opposition divided over its strategy on the SIR
content: Parties agree to ‘play it by the ear’ on protesting the Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls; it was agreed that a fresh call would be taken on December 3, after the government responded

title: IUML candidate takes on former party colleague and now CPI(M) candidate in Kaloor North division
content: The UDF candidate, T.K. Asharaf, who won the last election as an Independent, has since returned to the IUML and is now contesting as its official candidate; the LDF candidate, P.M. Harris, who won from the division as an IUML candidate in 2015, has since joined the CPI(M); and T.P. Pradeep Kumar of the BDJS makes it a predominantly three-cornered contest

title: SC asks Centre to consider allowing entry of pregnant woman pushed into Bangladesh
content: "The detainees have their relations residing in the State of West Bengal...the kind of overenthusiasm in deporting the detainees, as visible herein, is susceptible to misunderstanding and disturbs the judicial climate in the country," the Calcutta High Court order had stated.

title: Traffic, Not Stubble Burning, Keep Delhi Air 'Severe': Report
content: For most of October and November, Delhi pollution levels hovered between 'very poor' and 'severe', fuelled by a rising "toxic cocktail" of PM2.5, nitrogen dioxide (NO2) and carbon monoxide (CO) emitted mainly from vehicles and other local sources.

title: Delhi Court Asks Centre To Ensure Safety Of Indian Nurse Held Captive In Dubai
content: The Delhi High Court has directed the Centre and the Consulate General of India in Dubai to take immediate steps to ensure the safety and well-being of a 25-year-old Indian woman who is allegedly held captive in Dubai by a foreign national.

title: How A University Minted Money By Producing Fake Doctors For Rs 30,000 Each
content: A government university in Madhya Pradesh has been quietly running illegal medical courses producing hundreds of unqualified "doctors" who are now treating unsuspecting patients across the country.

title: Man Seen Dancing With Daughter's Lover, He's Now Arrested For His Murder
content: In April, he was seen dancing with his daughter and her boyfriend. Nearly seven months later, he is in police custody on charges of killing his daughter's boyfriend because he disapproved of their relationship.

title: 'They Wanted SUV': UP Woman Found Hanging, Parents Claim In-Laws Killed Her
content: A 26-year-old woman was found hanging under suspicious circumstances at her in-laws' house here, police said on Monday.

title: From Charges To Can He Be Pardoned: All About Netanyahu's Corruption Trial
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu took the stand on Monday for the first time since asking the country's president for a pardon in his long-running corruption trial.

title: CBI Arrests Suspect In 36-Year Old Kidnapping Of Rubaiyya Sayeed
content: The CBI has arrested a person in connection with the kidnapping of Rubaiyya Sayeed, daughter of then Union home minister Mufti Mohammed Sayeed, by JKLF terrorists on December 8, 1989, officials said Monday.

title: Bills In Lok Sabha Seek Levies On Tobacco, Pan Masala After GST Phaseout
content: The Central Excise (Amendment) Bill provides for a new central excise duty on tobacco products like cigarette, chewing tobacco, cigars, hookahs, zarda, and scented tobacco.

title: School Kitchens' Administration With State: Centre On Andhra Food Poisoning
content: Though the Centre reiterated the importance of adhering to the PM-POSHAN guidelines, it did not announce any new centralised inspection mechanism.

title: "Fresh Hope": Groundbreaking HIV Prevention Shots Begin In Africa
content: South Africa, Eswatini and Zambia on Monday began administering a groundbreaking new HIV-prevention injection in the drug's first public rollouts in Africa, which has the world's highest HIV burden.

title: Airbus Confirms "Supplier Quality Issue" On A320 Jet Panels
content: European plane-maker Airbus said Monday it had detected a "quality issue" affecting metal panels on its popular A320 passenger jet but the problem was "contained".

title: Debate On 150 Years Of 'Vande Mataram' Likely In Parliament This Week
content: Lok Sabha is likely to hold a special discussion later this week to mark 150 years of Vande Mataram, with the occasion providing members an opportunity to discuss aspects of India's cultural heritage

title: Global Arms Sales Hit Record $679 Billion Amid Wars, India's Revenue Up 8.2%
content: Revenues from sales of arms and military services by the 100 largest weapons-producing companies worldwide rose by 5.9 per cent last year, with demand boosted by the wars in Ukraine and Gaza.

title: India Pitches For Global Mechanism To Check "Misuse" Of Biological Weapons
content: India on Monday pitched for a global mechanism to check any possible misuse of biological weapons in view of the uncertain international security environment.

title: Agra Cop's Father Disputes Suicide, Claims She Was Strangled, Then Hanged
content: The father of a 28-year-old female constable who was claimed to have hanged herself has said she was likely strangled, police said on Monday.

title: "Those Who Bite Sit Inside": Row After Congress MP Renuka Chowdhury Brings Dog To Parliament
content: The Congress found itself in a rather unusual controversy after a party lawmaker arrived at Parliament with a puppy this morning.

title: Bangladesh Conducts Missile Launches In Bay Of Bengal As Part Of Sea Exercise
content: This exercise comes shortly after Pakistan's Navy Chief Admiral Naveed Ashraf met and held talks with his Bangladesh counterpart Admiral M Nazmul Hassan.

title: On Pollution, Minister Points To Central Body, Silent On Delhi Government Role
content: A monitoring mechanism has been put in place to oversee the implementation of 95 directions of the Centre-appointed Commission for Air Quality Management, Union minister Bhupender Yadav told the Lok Sabha today.

title: Over 1,100 Killed Across Asia Amid Deadly Flooding, Landslides
content: The death count in deadly flooding and landslides across parts of Asia climbed past 1,100 on Monday as hardest-hit Sri Lanka and Indonesia deployed military personnel to help survivors.

title: South zone nodal officer of Kerala's deceased donor organ donation programme resigns
content: Government has initiated disciplinary measures against M.K. Mohandas for portraying K-SOTTO in a bad light on social media

title: Voter indifference chugs along proposed Sabari rail route
content: Revival of project was expected to be a key poll plank in the local bodies in three districts, mainly the eastern regions of Ernakulam, but political parties remain silent about it with no clarity yet on when land acquisition for the ambitious project will restart

title: Thiruvalla MLA eligible for inclusion on revised voter list
content: Mathew T. Thomas’s name missing from the voter list being used for the SIR verification process. Since his father’s name is on the original register, the MLA’s name can be included on the revised list, says Collector

title: In maiden RS speech, NC's Chowdry Ramzan highlights J&K govt's limited powers
content: He said that while free and fair elections were held in the Union Territory in 2024, the elected government holds little executive authority on the affairs of the governance

title: Manipur govt. forms panels to rehabilitate violence-displaced people
content: The move followed the launch of a month-long protest by the internally displaced persons yearning to return home

title: GCDA permits sponsor to complete remaining works by December 20
content: The GCDA sought to give a clean chit to the sponsor, saying that Reporter Broadcasting Corporation, along with the government and Sports Kerala Foundation, had done everything possible to ensure fast progress and coordination of works

title: Kerala government orders rollback of UGC, AICTE incentive increments
content: State introduces reform mandating that UGC/AICTE pay revisions be sanctioned only after scrutiny by Finance department committee

title: Bidar’s Srimandal GP wins award for rural development excellence
content: Recognition for GP’s achievements in tax mobilisation, drinking water supply, health, hygiene, women’s empowerment, infrastructure development

title: Cusat, MoES ink pact
content: The MoU enables joint supervision of research scholars, student internships, access to national research facilities, participation in research cruises, polar expeditions, and ocean observation missions

title: TTD mandates uniform ‘annaprasadam’ quality across all temples
content: Executive Officer orders daily quality audits, staff training and stronger distribution systems to uphold Tirumala’s standards amid rising devotee numbers

title: Pre-install Sanchar Saathi app on new phones by March 2026, DoT tells phone makers
content: The move is meant to “safeguard the citizens from buying the non-genuine handsets, enabling easy reporting of suspected misuse of telecom resources and to increase effectiveness of the Sanchar Saathi initiative”

title: Karnataka High Court directs State government not to issue fresh recruitment notification with increased reservation in posts for SCs/STs
content: However, the court said the Government may continue the process of recruitment to the posts based on the notifications issued already as per increased reservation for SCs/STs prior to November 19, 2025.

title: AI transforming education, research quality, says expert
content: AI’s role in teaching and research was discussed during Faculty Development Programme at Vikrama Simhapuri University

title: India’s next economic leap will be harder than the breakthrough movement of 1991, says Montek Singh Ahluwalia
content: “India’s reform challenges are now qualitatively different from the early liberalisation phase, which mainly required persuading bureaucrats, while today’s problems cut across federal politics, climate pressures, technology disruptions, and global geopolitical fragmentation,” Montek Singh Ahluwalia

title: Naidu says NDA government delivers on welfare, development and seeks long-term mandate
content: Chief Minister highlights record spending on pensions, transparent paddy procurement and major investments flowing into Andhra Pradesh; urges farmers to adopt demand-driven crops and reiterates focus on regional development and completing Polavaram by 2027

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: What is the Kerala masala bond probe | Explained
content: What is masala bond? What is the ED probe and the controversy around it? What is the political angle in place? What is the way forward?

title: Covasant Tech opens AI innovation centre, to hire 3,000 AI engineers by 2028
content: At the inauguration, Minister Sridhar Babu says State’s AI University to begin operations soon; IT Secretary Sanjay Kumar says proposed AI Hub will be largest in India, create 10,000 high value AI jobs, train 1 crore people

title: Student found dead at KIIT University hostel in Bhubaneswar
content: The first year engineering student pursuing Computer Science programme was found hanging in his hostel room on Sunday, with the door locked from inside. A case of unnatural death has been registered. Earlier this year, two students from Nepal had ended their lives.

title: Telangana Tourism resumes Nagarjunasagar–Srisailam cruise with guided experiences, eco-friendly features
content: Cruise departs every Saturday at 9 a.m., proceeds through the reservoir and river stretch for nearly six hours

title: Madanapalle police crack major international ‘digital arrest’ syndicate; three persons arrested
content: Seize ₹32 lakh in cash, 25 ATM cards, three mobile phones and four SIM cards from the possession of the accused and freeze another ₹7.65 lakh in various bank accounts

title: ePlane Company targets 1st flight in 2 months; ambulance certification in 2027
content: Chethan Kumar is a Senior Assistant Editor with the Times of India. Aside from specialising in Space & Science, he has reported extensively on varied topics, with special focus on defence, policy and data stories. He has covered multiple elections, too. As a young democracy grows out of adolescence, Chethan feels, there are reels of tales emerging which need to be captured. To do this, he alternates between the mundane goings-on of the Common Man and the wonder-filled worlds of scientists and scamsters, politicians and soldiers. In a career spanning nearly 18 years, he has reported from multiple datelines — Houston, Florida, Kochi, Hyderabad, Chennai, Sriharikota (AP), NH-1 (J&K Highway), New Delhi, Ahmedabad, Raichur, Bhatkal, Mysuru, Chamarajanagar, to name a few —  but is based out of Bengaluru, India’s science capital that also hosts the ISRO HQ. Read More

title: Asia’s arms race shift: India climbs, China slides on PLA graft charges
content: global arms revenues surged to an all-time high of $679 billion in 2024, up 5.9% in real terms . Asia and Oceania stood out as the only region to post a decline . China's arms revenues fell 10%, a setback tied to a wave of corruption scandals and major contract delays .

title: Who is NBA Cup MVP? Can anyone stop OKC? Big questions ahead of the quarters
content: the Emirates NBA Cup wrapped its group stage Friday to set up four matchups, each with a trip to Las Vegas at stake . the group stage is set to begin on tuesday . a panel of insiders is breaking down another year of thrilling group stage play and previewing the quarters .

title: Takeaways: A chaotic tiebreaker in the ACC, plus surprising wins
content: the 2025 regular season has come and gone, and the stages are set for conference title games this week . the chaos in the ACC continues as arguably the best team in the conference will miss the title game this season . Texas earned its biggest win of the season after taking down undefeated No. 3 Texas A&M on Friday evening .

title: Survivor Series WarGames: Who is the masked man who attacked CM Punk?
content: mystery fighter interrupts main event of WarGames to help Brock Lesnar, Bron Breakker and their team win . AJ Lee pinned Becky Lynch in the women's wargames match . that's the biggest question after Saturday's Survivor Series .

title: AP Week 14 poll reaction: What's next for each Top 25 team
content: Texas A&M lost its spot in the SEC championship game and its undefeated season . the rest of the teams in position to reach the CFP all managed to win . let's break down the rankings .

title: Where Kentucky ranks among the open Power 4 jobs
content: all four power conferences have had a firing in the first half of the season . the ouster of James Franklin sent a message around the sport: Almost no coach is safe . there are now nine schools looking for head coaches: UCLA, Cal, and now Michigan State .

title: Projecting Tuesday's penultimate CFP top 12
content: 11 of the committee's top 12 teams won during Rivalry Week . the résumés are complete, with exception of teams that will play for their respective conference championship games . a fifth and penultimate ranking Tuesday night will be the best indicator all season .

title: Will there be baseball in 2027? Is a salary cap coming? What you need to know about MLB's looming labor battle﻿
content: the league's current labor agreement expires on Dec. 1, 2026 . there are major hurdles to clear and some key areas of disagreement . a lockout would shut down free agency and trades, as it did in 2021 .

title: Air India Express flight makes emergency landing at Trichy airport due to technical snag
content: Deepak is Trichy-based journalist working as Assistant Editor for The Times of India, covering central and Cauvery delta districts in Tamil Nadu. He writes on politics, transport, urban infrastructure, industries and technology. Deepak has completed his Bachelor of Technology (B.Tech) in Mechanical engineering from Sastra university and holds a Post Graduate Diploma in Journalism and Public Relations from Bharathidasan university. title: Maha local polls: Cracks appear in Mahayuti; Shinde pitches 'dharma of alliance' amid poaching row

title: 🏈 CFB Power Rankings: Texas Tech into top five
content: coach's prolonged employment decision didn't really qualify as surprising for those who have followed his career . Trinidad Chambliss was one of the season's most delightful surprises . he finished the regular season with 3,016 passing yards and 18 touchdowns .

title: What actually matters from every Week 13 game: Top AFC seed for Broncos? Panthers are legit?
content: the Bears extended their win streak to five games with a decisive win over the Eagles on black Friday . the 49ers trimmed the Rams' NFC West lead by a dominant victory over the Browns . Tampa Bay broke its three-game losing streak, the Dolphins won their third straight .
